Satta King 2019.description: NEW DELHI: Satta Matka is a form of gambling or lottery that had originated before the Independence of India.Originally, the game of Matka gambling involved betting on the opening and closing rates of cotton as transmitted to the Bombay Cotton Exchange from the New York Cotton Exchange, via teleprinters.The modern-day Matka gambling/ Satta King is based on random number selection and betting. The players participating in the Satta Matka game/ gambling are required to choose the right number for winning the game. The player who wins the game becomes Satta King and is rewarded financially. Two of the most famous Matka games are - Kalyan and Worli. The Kalyan Matka gambling was started by Kalyanji Bhagat, a farmer from Gujarat, in 1962 and it ran for all days of the week. Another Matka gambling, New Worli Matka, was started by the Rattan Khatri in 1964 with slight modifications to the rules of the game. Khatri’s Matka ran only five days a week, from Monday to Friday.The modern Matka business is centred around Maharashtra.Some of the terms used in the game and their meaning is given below:    Term Meaning   Matka Matka means earthen pot that were used to draw numbers   Single Any digit between 0 and 9   Jodi/Pair Any pair of two digits between 00 and 99    Patti/Panna Three digit number    Open result / close result Outcome of matka betting   Berij Berij is last digit of jodi's/pair's sum The Google 2018 trends data shows that 'satta' and 'matka' were the top searched words in the Madhya Pradesh state in the year 2018. As per the Google data, 'satta' was the 4th most searched word with a score of 36 and 'matka' came 6th with a score of 23.Any form of Satta Matka gambling is illegal in India.Disclaimer: This content is for reference purpose only and The Times of India claims no ownership of this content. The Times of India does not support or promote piracy in any manner.Download The Times of India News App for Latest India News.

UP: Dalit man burnt alive in Pratapgarh.description: LUCKNOW: A dalit-man was allegedly burnt alive under Patti police station area of Pratapgarh in Uttar Pradesh on Monday. The incident came to light when the villagers in Belarampur village woke up and went to the fields only to find charred body of one Vinay Prakash Saroj (33). They later informed the kin of Saroj. Pratapgarh SP Avanish Mishra told TOI that Saroj had come to sleep in the fields for guarding his haystack on late Sunday night. The sequence of events leading to the death of Saroj is yet to be ascertained. "The post-mortem examination is being conducted which will provide clues in the causes of his death. We are yet to get any complaint from the kin of deceased so far,” added Mishra. Uttar Pradesh chairman of SC/ST Commission Brij Lal has condemned the incident and instructed the police to arrest the accused. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 WB.description: KOLKATA: The BJP in its first list of 28 candidates for West Bengal has pinned hopes on its veterans and defectors from the ruling Trinamool Congress to take on the Mamata Banerjee's government in the state. Of the 28 candidates, nearly 25 are new faces, with a thrust on active political workers rather than greenhorns from the glamour world. The saffron party, which bagged two Lok Sabha seats in the 2014 elections, is now targeting 23 of the state's 42 constituencies. BJP Lok Sabha first full listUnlike the TMC list, which had 18 new faces and a mix of both old-timers and greenhorns, hardcore politicians and personalities from the film industry, the BJP has put faith on its own leaders and defectors from other parties. There are four women candidates and one Muslim nominee in the first list. Of the candidates, five had recently defected to the saffron party from the Trinamool Congress and one from the CPI(M). West Bengal: Track here Lok Sabha elections' full coverageUnion minister and BJP MP from Asansol Lok Sabha constituency Babul Supriyo has been renominated from the same seat and is pitted against actor Moon Moon Sen of the TMC. State BJP president Dilip Ghosh will contest from Medinipur seat against TMC leader Manas Bhunia. BJP national secretary Rahul Sinha will take on TMC heavyweight Sudip Bandopadhyay in Kolkata North Lok Sabha seat. State BJP vice-president and Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose grandnephew, Chandra Kumar Bose will contest from Kolkata South Lok Sabha seat. Former IPS officer Bharati Ghosh, once known to be close to Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, will be fighting against TMC candidate and actor Dipak Adhikary, popularly known as 'Dev', from Ghatal Lok Sabha constituency. The BJP has fielded former Trinamool Congress MLA Arjun Singh from Barrackpur Lok Sabha seat. Singh, who had recently joined the saffron party, has been pitted against TMCs Dinesh Trivedi. In Coochbebar Lok Sabha seat, the party has fielded former TMC youth leader Nishith Pramanik, while in Jadavpur Lok Sabha seat, expelled TMC MP Anupam Hazra will contest against TMC's Mimi Chakraborty, an actor by profession. Another former TMC MP Soumitra Khan, who joined the BJP in January, has been given ticket from Bishnupur(SC) Lok Sabha seat. Former CPI(M) MLA Khagen Murmu, who too had switched over to the BJP, will contest from Malda North seat and will take on TMCs Mausam Benazir Noor, who had recently defected to the party from the Congress, in Malda Uttar seat. The Lok Sabha elections in the state will be held from April 11 till May 19 in seven phases. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

8 killed, 11 critical in UP highway mish.description: BAREILLY: At least eight people were killed and 10 sustained serious injuries after a DCM truck and a passengers utility vehicle (PUV) had a head-on collision on Agra-Moradabad highway in Sambhal district at around 1:30 am on Wednesday. People who met with the fatal accident were coming from neighbouring Budaun district after participating in a wedding ritual. Upon learning the incident, police rushed to the spot and pulled out injured persons from severly damaged vehicles and took them to hospital. Police said that the people killed in gruesome incident were residents of Budaun, Sambhal and Chandausi. "People from Laharvana village in Sambhal had gone to Chachipur village in Budaun to participate in Lagna ceremony of one Ram Bharose's daughter, while those travelling in the DCM truck were coming back home at the time incident occurred. The collision was drastic as both vehicles turned turtle on the road," ASP Pankaj Pandey said. Those who were killed have been identified as Pavan (8), Horilal (65), Ramkumar (65), Ranveer (50), Dinesh Sharma (40), Hari Shankar (55), Brijesh (10) and Sher Singh (40). Critically injured persons include Chandrapal, Ram Svaroop, Ajay Kumar, Aman, Priyanshu, Jayprakash, Mukesh Pal, Somesh, Kishanveer, Ajay Pal and Rinku. SHO Satendra Singh said that all bodies had been sent for postmortem examination while injured persons were referred to district hospital after being provided with first aid at community health center. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Conmen pose as STF staff, dupe.description: LUCKNOW: Two men impersonating as STF officials robbed a woman of her ornaments in Mahanagar by conning her on Monday. This is the 40th such incident in the city in this year alone. The complainant, Kusumlata Dubey of Badshahnagar railway colony, informed the police that two unidentified miscreants stopped her near Rajkiya Balika Inter College in Nishatganj on Monday morning. “They introduced themselves as STF officials and told me that a murder had taken place in the locality. Intimidating me in the name of checking, they forced me to take off my gold chain and put it in a paper bag they had. They gave me the bag but when I opened it, I found there were pieces of stones inside it,” she told police. CO Mahanagar Santosh Singh said, “We are working on the menace of conning in the city. The modus operandi shows that a specific gang is on the prowl and is pretending to be cops to con people.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Trauma centre to come up along Agra e-wa.description: Along with petrol pumps, chief minister Yogi Adityanath has said that more restaurants, dhabas and a trauma centre should also be built along the Lucknow-Agra Expressway. Reviewing the work of UPEIDA on Monday, the CM further directed that one official each should be made responsible for the Purvanchal Expressway, Bundelkhand Expressway, defence corridor and Ganga Expressway. These officials will be posted on the field to monitor the projects on a continuous basis. They will be required to submit regular reports to the government to ensure that all the projects are completed on time. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Ushoshi Sengupta.description: KOLKATA: A gang of 10 bikers chased around Kolkata-based model Ushoshi Sengupta’s app cab through the streets of south Kolkata and harassed her — not once but twice — late on Monday night. The last round of harassment occurred after cops at a police station “refused to register her complaint” but, instead, referred her to the “right police station”.   Cops from Bhowanipore arrived around 10-15 minutes later. It was past midnight by then and Sengupta decided to pursue the case on Tuesday morning and requested the cabby to drop her colleague and her off at their homes. But the nightmare was far from being over. “The boys had followed us till my colleague’s house and, right when we were dropping him at Lake Gardens, six of them on three bikes came and stopped the car. They pelted stones, smashing the window. They then dragged me out and tried to break my phone to delete the video. Luckily, local people heard my cries for help and came out. The boys then fled,” Sengupta recalled.   She then called her father and sister; her own residence was just a lane away. They called cops, who came and asked her to file an FIR at the Charu Market police station. It was 1.30 a.m. when she reached there but, instead of taking down her complaint, the cops there directed her to Bhowanipore police station where the first assault had occured. “I just gave up and started shouting at this point. There was no female police officer. The officer there finally took down my complaint after asking a lot of questions but refused to take the cabby’s complaint, stating that two FIR could not be taken for the same incident,” she said. Frustrated and hapless, she returned home. It was at 2.30 p.m. on Tuesday that she posted the entire ordeal on Facebook along with a 20-second video clip. An additional CP later called Sengupta and assured her of strong action against not just the accused but an inquiry into police refusal to take her complaint citing jurisdiction issues. “The probe has just begun and we have identified all the culprits. More arrests are likely and we will probe whether there was lack of adequate response from cops,” said a Lalbazar official. The arrested were identified as Sheikh Rahit, Fardeen Khan, Sheikh Shabir Ali, Sheikh Gani, Sheikh Imran Ali, Sheikh Wasim and Atif Khan alias Md Samsad. A preliminary inquiry revealed the cab had accidentally brushed against the bike, causing the riders to lose balance. One of the bikes’ rear view mirrors broke and the youths accosted cabby Tarak Debnath to demand compensation. At least two more bikes and an auto carrying more people landed there, leading to the sequence of events ending with the assault at Lake Gardens, officials said. In Video:Kolkata: Former Miss India Ushoshi Sengupta harassed, 7 arrestedDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Chandrababu Naidu.description: KURNOOL: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday launched a blistering attack on Andhra Pradesh chief minister and erstwhile ally N Chandrababu Naidu, calling him 'u-turn Babu', whose "intent" was not on state's development. Addressing a well-attended election rally here, he sought to reject Naidu's repeated attacks that his government neglected the state. Andhra Pradesh goes to siumultaneous elections to the 175-member assembly and 25 Lok Sabha seats in the first phase on April 11 with the BJP contesting them alone. Listing various initiatives taken by the NDA government for Andhra Pradesh, Modi said it was during his regime that the Vizag-Chennai industrial corridor was flagged off and approval for the first National Institute of Ocean Technology (NIOT) given. It was also the 'chowkidar' who cleared the first Indian Institute of Packaging (IIP) besides approving the greenfield petrochemical complex for the state, he said. "Five years ago, your one vote made me PM. Your Pradhan sewak worked selflessly day and night for the people of the country. Chowkidar kept the interest of the state in mind," he said. Modi also recalled that the NDA government sanctioned first central university in Anantpur. He accused Naidu, the Telugu Desam Party supremo, of pasting state government 'stickers' on the Central schemes. "For sure, I could have done more work. I just required the cooperation of the state government. I made all efforts from my side, but the person who is running the government (Naidu), his intention is not Andhra Pradesh's development," Modi said. Levelling charges of corruption and dynasty politics against Naidu, he said the election date of April 11 will usher in the "double engine" of the state's growth -- a BJP government both at the Centre and the state. There was debate going on in AP that there were 'schemes for corruption,' ranging from the creation of the new capital Amravati, the Prime Minister charged. "The people of Andhra Pradhesh know whose coffers are being filled.. when this chowkidar sought accounts, u-turn Babu took a u-turn from AP's growth and walked out from NDA," Modi lashed out. Naidu had snapped ties with the NDA in March last year, accusing the Centre of not honouring the "promised" special category status to Andhra Pradesh. Hitting out at the TDP supremo for getting close to the Congress, Modi said Naidu has "found friends who are on bail," apparently referring to Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Sonia Gandhi who are on bail in the National Herald case. Modi, who had in the past hit out at Naidu for alleged family politics, said the election should also see the "son set", and called for a new "sun rise." He deliberately stressed on the "son" part to drive home his point on dynasty politics targeting the AP chief minister and his son and state minister Nara Lokesh. Without elaborating, Modi mocked that Pakistan has now accepted Naidu's "friends" as "hero." Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Satta Matka 2018.description: AGRA: Shyam Vohra, known as 'satta king' of the Taj city, was denied bail by district court of Agra. Vohra, who was arrested by the Agra police in July for his alleged involvement in betting on FIFA World Cup matches. Earlier, in April, Vohra was arrested by the Nodia STF from Greater Noida for placing bets on IPL matches, but he was granted bail. After Vohra’s arrest, Agra police booked him and his known associates including his son Vatsal, wife Rakhi, nephew Prateek, brother-in-law Kaushal and others for their alleged involvement in betting. On Monday, judge Anil Kumar Pundhir rejected Vohra’s bail plea, who was charged for attempt to murder, as he allegedly opened fire on policemen. Further, Vohra was charged for running illegal gambling racket, criminal conspiracy and obstructing policemen from executing their duties. Police are yet to arrest the relatives and associates of Vohra. Several years back, Vohra had gain notoriety for betting on cricket matches. In April, during IPL matches, the gambling racket run by Vohra had deposited Rs 62 lakh in 10 banks, after which police approached banks to freeze the amount. Even during the FIFA World Cup, Vohra collected huge amount of cash through betting. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lok Sabha Poll 2019.description: LUCKNOW: With electioneering for the 2019 Lok Sabha polls gaining steam in Uttar Pradesh, political leaders are increasingly resorting to personal attacks on their adversaries. If the maverick BJP MLA from Bairia, Surendra Singh hit the headlines for his remarks against BSP supremo Mayawati, Uttar Pradesh cabinet minister Shrikant Sharma hit a new low by making indecent comments on Congress chief Rahul Gandhi. The Bairia MLA had said Mayawati gets facials done and her hair coloured even though she is 60-years-old. He also reportedly made offensive remarks against UPA chairperson Sonia Gandhi and Haryanvi singer-dancer Sapna Chaudhary, evoking widespread criticism from political parties and social media users. A media agency quoted him as saying that both Sonia Gandhi and Sapna Chaudhary used to work as dancers. "Rahul's mother (Sonia Gandhi) was also in the same profession in Italy and his father made her his own. He (Rahul Gandhi) should also take the family tradition forward and make Sapna his own," the MLA said. The BJP legislator, who is known for his controversial statements, had earlier termed Rahul Gandhi and his sister Priyanka Gandhi Vadra "Ravana and Shurpanakha", and accused Mayawati of "murdering" a woman's dignity by joining hands with one-time arch rival Samajwadi Party. UP Power Minister Shrikant Sharma stirred up a hornet's nest with his tweet terming the Congress president a "coward and impotent". The comments triggered a war of words between the two parties as well as on social media platform. Firebrand Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath also finds mention in the list of leaders accused of making personal remarks against political rivals. He recently termed Congress candidate from Saharanpur, Imran Masood, the son-in-law of Jaish-e-Mohammed chief Azhar Masood. Addressing a rally in Saharanpur on Sunday, Adityanath said, "The son-in-law of Azhar Masood has entered the constituency and he speaks the language of the terror mastermind. "You people have to ensure that the person who speaks the language of Azhar Masood is defeated in the Lok Sabha elections," he said while seeking votes for BJP candidate from Saharanpur, Raghav Lakhanpal. Union minister and BJP MP Mahesh Sharma referred to Rahul Gandhi as 'Pappu' and his sister Priyanka Gandhi as 'Pappu ki Pappi' during a poll campaign in Gautam Buddh Nagar. Rahul Gandhi has often been mocked by the BJP and his opposition as 'Pappu', a colloquial sneer. "Pappu kehta hai main prime minister banunga Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu.. aur ab 'Pappu ki Pappi' bhi aa gayi hai. Wo Priyanka kya pehle hamare desh ki beti nahi thi kya, Congress ki beti nahi thi kya, aage nahi rahegi kya? kya naya leke aayi hai?" the minister told a crowd of his supporters on March 16. The quotes loosely translate to "Pappu says he wants to become prime minister. Mayawati, Akhilesh Yadav, Pappu ... and now 'Pappu's Pappi' has also arrived. Wasn't Priyanka already a daughter of this nation, a daughter of the Congress? And would she not remain so in future? What new has she brought in?" Download The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Gang supplying spirit to hooch shops bus.description: LUCKNOW: With the arrest of seven persons, UP Special Task Foce (STF) on Sunday claimed to have busted a gang supplying rectified spirit (used to make illicit liquor) to countrymade liquor shops in districts like Barabanki, Lucknow, Sitapur, Chitrakoot, Kanpur Dehat. STF sleuths seized more than 5,000 litres of rectified spirit and 1.10 lakh QR (quick response) code slips of different English and countrymade liquor brands from the accused. The accused were all natives of Rae Bareli and were nabbed from Bachhrawan area of Rae Bareli . STF SSP Abhishek Singh said that Suraj Lal, who has been arrested, was the gang leader. The gang smuggled rectified liquor from one Gyanendra in Fatehpur and smuggle them to various places in Barabanki, Lucknow, Sitapur, Chitrakoot, Kanpur Dehat for preparing illict liquor and then selling to countrymade shops. “Lal used to make a profit of Rs 2,000 on the sale of each set of illicit liquor,” said Singh. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Critical day ahead for Lucknow as doctor.description: LUCKNOW: Health care services in the state capital will be crippled for 24 hours starting Monday 6am as over 10,000 medical practitioners, including those in government and private sectors, will strike work in solidarity with their brethren in West Bengal. Emergency and trauma services will be functional but there will be no out-patient-department (OPD) services and elective surgeries will have to be postponed. The resident doctors of King George’s Medical University (KGMU) and Queen Mary’s hospital, Sanjay Gandhi Post Graduate Institute of Medical Sciences (SGPGIMS) and Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Institute of Medical Sciences (RMLIMS) will stay away from work till Tuesday 6am. The 24-hour strike has been called by Indian Medical Association (IMA) in support of the stir of junior doctors of NRS Medical College, Kolkata, who were attacked on June 10. As a precautionary measure, chief medical officer (CMO) of Lucknow, Dr Narendra Agarwal has asked all district hospitals and community health care centres to be prepared for rush of patients and make necessary arrangements to ensure that no needy is deprived of medical care. If the strike is not called off, and services are hit, Dr Ram Manohar Lohia combined hospital, Lokbandhu Rajnarayan hospital, Balrampur hospital, Rani Laxmibai combined hospital, BRD hospital, Ram Sagar Mishra hospital, Veerangana Avanti Bai women’s hospital and Veerangana Jhalkari Bai women’s hospital would see a surge in patients. “The resident doctors’ associations of KGMU, SGPGIMS and RMLIMS have decided to strike on IMA’s call. We will not let emergency services get affected,” said KGMU RDA president, Dr Nayani Amrin. Not just medical colleges, private diagnostic and medical centres in the city will also join the strike. “The 1,000 diagnostic centres, pathology laboratories, nursing homes and private clinics affiliated to IMA and otherwise will also remain shut for 24 hours,” said IMA member, Dr PK Gupta. SGPGIMS faculty forum secretary Dr M S Ansari said that they support the cause but will not strike work. RDA president, Dr Ajay Shukla said, “There are 500 resident doctors at SGPGIMS, and all will be on strike. We will also take out protest march in morning and evening on Monday.” Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP government to now issue press release.description: LUCKNOW: For possibly the first time in the state, the UP government will now be issuing important press notes, the chief minister’s speeches and messages in Sanskrit. The language will join Hindi, English and Urdu as one of the media for disbursal of information. Officials said that though there aren’t many Sanskrit publications in UP—notable exceptions being a publication in Allahabad and a few magazines—the aim of releasing information in Sanskrit was to reach a target audience on social media and help scholars of Sanskrit use official material. “On September 6, 2018, CM Yogi Adityanath had expressed the desire to have his speeches and messages published in Sanskrit. In pursuance of this, we recently asked the chairperson of the Sanskrit Sansthan to translate a press note on the Niti Ayog meeting in Sanskrit and it was received very well on social media. This is the government’s bid to keep alive a language and we will now send out important information in Sanskrit more regularly,” said an official. The government’s information department is expected to hire content writers for this job. Sources said that scholars in the Sanskrit Sansthan, including their MA students, were a ready pool of experts who could do this work. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

PM Modi.description: JEYPORE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said his government had taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' in space and asked people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions and not just raise slogans. Launching his campaign in eastern India with a rally in Jeypore area of Odisha's Koraput district, the prime minister said the NDA government wouldn't have been able to do any development work in the country without the support of the people. He sought blessings from his supporters for the 2019 Lok Sabha elections and asserted that the NDA government has left no stone unturned to bring about development in the state. Land, air or space, we had courage to do surgical strikes: PM Modi"The NDA government has been working hard to develop road and rail infrastructure in the state. There is no dearth of funds when it comes to development work in the country. "In the last five years, the government has been able to build homes for eight lakh families, light up 3,000 houses and provide gas connections to 40 lakh homes," Modi stated. Referring to Mission Shakti, when India demonstrated anti-satellite (ASAT) missile capability by shooting down a live satellite, he said the government has taken measures to set up a 'chowkidar' (watchman) in space. He came down heavily on opposition parties who he said "belittled" the space achievement. "Those that are criticising the anti-satellite technology will be given a befitting reply in the elections," he claimed, urging people to vote for a government that can take concrete decisions, not the one that only raises slogans. In Video:Govt has taken measures to set up 'chowkidar' in space: PM Narendra Modi in OdishaDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

No takers for Hindi, Urdu courses at Luc.description: LUCKNOW: It is not just Hindi and Sanskrit which are not finding takers at Lucknow University but there are 15 such subjects out of the 39 offered which have seen dismal response. More than 40% seats in these BA or BA (Hons) courses are likely to remain vacant as candidates are not choosing them. The university will conduct the final counselling for the two courses on Tuesday. Till late Monday evening, as many as 489 seats in various subjects were lying vacant. With only a day left for admissions to be finalised, the chances of these seats getting filled are dim. In subjects like home science, Urdu, Arab culture, French, jyotir vigyan and Arabic, more than 30% of seats are vacant while in Persian, not a single seat of the 60 has a candidate. Even honours courses such as public policy and Hindi have failed to attract candidates with just 50% seats filled in both. For admission to 60 seats each in public policy and Hindi, only 28 and 31 candidates turned up, respectively. Admission coordinator Anil Mishra cited poor choice of career options and less familiarity of students with these subjects as the reasons behind the response. Lok Sabha Elections in Tamil Nadu.description: NEW DELHI: Tamil Nadu goes to polls in the second phase of the seven-phase elections. Elections to 39 parliamentary seats will take place on April 18 in a single-phase polling. Lok Sabha elections 2019: Get all live updatesTOP CONTENDERSThe four-cornered contest features AIADMK-led National Democratic Alliance (NDA), its chief rival DMK-led Secular Progressive Alliance (SPA), actor Kamal Haasan's Makkal Needhi Maiam and TTV Dhinakaran's Amma Makkal Munnetra Kazhagam (AMMK). This time the elections are taking place sans the Dravidian stalwarts M Karunanidhi and J Jayalalithaa. AIADMK chief Jayalalithaa passed away in December 2016 while Karunanidhi died in August 2018. While the DMK is contesting on 20 seats, the Congress is fighting elections on 9 seats in Tamil Nadu. In the AIADMK-BJP alliance, the national party will be contesting from five seats in the state while the PMK will be contesting from seven. Tamil Nadu Lok Sabha elections: Get all live updatesHOW MANY SEATS?Tamil Nadu has 39 Lok Sabha seats and one in neighbouring Puducherry. Here is the list of constituencies: Arakkonam, Arani, Chennai Central, Chennai North, Chennai South, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Erode, Kallakurichi, Kancheepuram(SC), Kanyakumari, Karur, Krishnagiri, Madurai, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam(SC), Namakkal Nilgiris(SC), Perambalur, Pollachi, Ramanathapuram, Salem, Sivaganga, Sriperumbudur, Tenkasi(SC), Thanjavur, Theni, Thiruvallur(SC), Thoothukudi, Tiruchirapalli, Tirunelveli, Tiruppur, Tiruvannamalai, Vellore, Villupuram(SC), Virudhunagar, Puducherry(Union Territory) KEY CONSTITUENCIESThe key constutuencies include Sivaganga, Chennai South, Chennai North, Chennai Central, Chidambaram(SC), Coimbatore, Cuddalore, Dharmapuri, Dindigul, Kanyakumari, Karur, Thoothukudi , Nilgiris(SC), Trichy, Vellore amd Arani. 6 students of RMLIMS suspended for assau.description: Lucknow: Dr Ram Manohar Lohia Institute of Medical Sciences (RMLIMS) on Tuesday suspended six MBBS students for vandalising a general store opposite the campus in Gomtinagar and beating up its owner on Monday. The students are from the 2017 and 2018 batches, and were participating in a 24-hour strike sponsored by junior doctors. The owner of the store, Ranjeet Yadav, has accused 10-15 unidentified students of trespassing, vandalism, assault and theft after he scolded one of them for spraying a deodorant without permission. Director of RMLIMS professor AK Tripathi set up a three-member internal committee to probe the allegations. The preliminary report on Tuesday vindicated Yadav’s claims and identified six students from CCTV camera footage from the store. The institute has asked professor Ishwar Dayal to submit a report in 15 days for action. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP: All new bus stations to be outside c.description: LUCKNOW: All bus stations will be constructed outside towns and cities from now on. The instruction came from chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday during a review of the transport department. The stations should serve multiple purposes, he said, each having multilevel parking and shopping plazas, etc. Directions have been given for construction of bus stations at Baghpat, Shamli and Chandauli. Meanwhile, to subsidise travel for those living in rural areas, the chief minister has said that bus passes should be issued to them at “reasonable rates”. In view of the upcoming traffic safety week, the CM has asked transport department officials to begin a crackdown on overloaded vehicles and those violating traffic rules. The CM has also asked the department to carry out a programme in schools for two weeks, from July 15 to 30, and teach students about traffic rules. It was also shared that after becoming the first state in the country to start issuing e-challans, the department had issued e-challans of Rs 5.97 crore in 2018-19. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Agony fails to melt striking doctors\u20.description: LUCKNOW: The strike by more than 10,000 junior doctors in the city had serious repercussions on a number of patients, many of whom are suffering from serious ailments like cancer. With no doctors to attend to them, these patients lay in pain even as their family members haplessly sought help from the hospital staff. Cancer patient on floor, doctors absentRajendra Pratap lay on a bedhsheet on the floor of KGMU’s haematology department. His wife Malti Devi kept begged for help to get her husband, a cancer patient, admitted to the Emergency. The couple had come from Basti on Monday along with their son Manoj Kumar but were denied admission in wake of the strike. The family is poor and cannot afford treatment in private hospital. “The people in the hospital are asking me to come back tomorrow. But I don’t think my husband would survive if we take him back to home. We will stay at the hospital because we don’t have anywhere to go,” she said. Office leave goes in vainParas Saxena took a leave from office and brought his mother from Shahjahanpur to get her medical tests done at KGMU. But owing to strike the test were postponed to Tuesday. Paras said he did not have enough money to stay in a hotel. “We will spend our night in the corridors of KGMU. Also, I will have to take another day’s off. We had come last week too to take an appointment and had got it after standing in a long queue,” he said. Diabetic woman’s bitter experienceThe journey from Basti to Lucknow was an ordeal for Roop Ratna, whose body has swelled up due to diabetes. Riding on her will power, she arrived in the city in the hope that doctors would end her misery. But that did not happen. Despite her son’s repeated requests, the staff at Ram manohar Lohia Institute refused to admit her. “Why should we suffer if something wrong happened in Bengal. I came here with all my family members and now they have refused to admit me. I am not in a condition to go anywhere else because of my illness,” she complained. Disabled son by side, mom on her ownSavitri Devi, a Rae Bareli resident, had brought her differnetly abled son Sonu Singh to KGMU OPD. But no OPD registrations were done as junior doctors remained on strike. Savitri Devi was livid as her son was in acute pain. “What is the fault of my son? Why should he be made to suffer? I reached the hospital on time but nobody is ready to attend to my son. Now, I will have return to Rae Bareli and take my son to a private hospital,” she said. Cancer patient sleeps on roadRupa (35), a blood cancer patient, had been given Monday’s appointment in the haematology OPD of KGMU. She, along with her brother, had reached Lucknow from Siddharth Nagar on Sunday night itself and was among the firsts to stand in the queue at the registration counter on Monday. However, two hours later the hospital staff informed her that the appointment had been cancelled as doctors were on strike. She still did not leave the queue. Finally, at 11.30am, hospital staff told all patients to leave. “I will have to stay here on footpath so that I can see the doctor on Tuesday. I don’t have enough money to go back and come again later this week,” she said. Yes to meeting, no to treatmentSatya Bansal was operated upon recently for an intestine related disease and has an external bag attached on his stomach. He came from Gorakhpur on Monday morning, unaware about the doctors’ strike, and got his registration done. He even met his doctor but the latter told him that he won’t be able to attend to him because no junior doctor was present in the hospital to assist him in the check-ups. Woman misses chemotherapyDinesh Mishra had accompanied his cancer-stricken wife Neelam from Siddharth Nagar for chemotherapy. But the couple were in for a shock when the doctors at RML Insituite told them it had been posponed in the wake of strike. “I was given June 17 appointment for chemotherapy of my wife and now I am worried what to do as I have no other option. I asked the doctor about the next date but he was clueless,” said Dinesh. (With inputs from Urooj Khan, Pranchal Srivastava, Rahul Tripathi, Aditya Shukla ,Shambhavi Mishra and Niba Mirza) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Uttar Pradesh: Principals, headmasters t.description: LUCKNOW: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday issued instructions that selection of principals and head masters of government, aided and recognised schools should be done through Uttar Pradesh Public Service Commission (UPPSC) and further added that a Shiksha Seva Chayan Aayog be set up to recruit teachers. Yogi passed the instructions to officials during a review meeting of education department. UPPSC had been already conducting selection of principals of government inter colleges and government girls’ inter colleges. Now, it will also recruit principals of aided schools. Reviewing the basic and secondary education departments, the CM also added that the midday meal scheme in Lucknow and Mathura should be linked to Aadhaar number of students . “The CM was annoyed over the delay in providing textbooks, bags, and uniforms to students and has directed the department to do so immediately. He further said that milk being provided to students once a week should be checked for quality,” said an official present at the meeting. The CM has also asked for instituting a state award to encourage teachers and honour the good work being done by them, said sources. The criteria for selecting the winners will be fixed. Basic Shiksha Adhikaris (BSAs) posted in one district for many years should be transferred and all of them should inspect schools within their jurisdiction each day, CM Yogi further added. Reiterating the directions issued in the last meeting, the CM said that officials should carry out as many field visits as possible to inspect schools and interact with principals, teachers and guardians of students. He also instructed principals to meet parents of students twice a year. Yogi also said that strict action should be taken against any official who fails to clear files within three days, unless necessary. He further said that solar panels should be installed in schools. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Tejashwi Yadav.description: PATNA/ BHAGALPUR: RJD chief Lalu Prasad’s younger son and leader of opposition in Bihar legislative assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav kicked off the Lok Sabha election campaign on Monday by addressing public meetings at Gaya, Banka and Bhagalpur in support of the Mahagathbandhan candidates. Close aides of Tejashwi said he is expected to address around 200 election meetings across the state over the next two months. “Tejashwi is the face of RJD and the star campaigner of Mahagathbandhan. He will be canvassing for candidates of all the Mahagathbandhan constituents — RJD, Congress, RLSP, HAM(S) and VIP. Thus, he will be addressing three to four election meetings every day,” Tejashwi’s political adviser Sanjay Yadav told TOI on Monday. Canvassing for RJD candidate Shailesh Kumar alias Bulo Mandal from Bhagalpur, Tejashwi came down heavily on NDA governments at the Centre and in state. He accused PM Narendra Modi of making false promises and propaganda to win the 2014 general election. “It won’t be repeated in the ensuing Lok Sabha elections,” Tejashwi said while raising questions about employment scenario and issues of Vijay Malaya, Nirav Modi, Mehul Chowksi and others who fled the country after swindling money from banks in India. Criticizing Nitish for snapping ties with RJD in 2017, Tejashwi said there was acute shortage of fertilizers, while the health services were also in a poor state. He accused deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi of protecting those involved in the multi-crore Srijan scam in Bhagalpur and some other districts. Urging the audience to vote for the RJD candidate, Tejashwi said the Bhagalpur voters had showed a mirror to Modi by voting for RJD in 2014. “They should do the same this election as the NDA government stands exposed,” he said. Political observers feel Tejashwi has become a good orator, especially after coming out of power in July 2017 when CM Nitish Kumar snapped ties with RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and rejoined BJP-led NDA. “Though not as good as his father in terms of having a rustic touch, Tejashwi is a good orator in terms of eloquence,” said DM Diwakar, political observer and professor at AN Sinha Institute of Social Studies. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

BJP List 2019 Tamilnadu.description: CHENNAI: The BJP's Tamil Nadu candidates list announced on Thursday was on expected lines, with Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan being fielded from Kanyakumari, state chief Tamilisai Soundararajan in Tuticorin, national secretary H Raja in Sivaganga, C P Radhakrishnan in Coimbatore and vice-president Nainar Nagendran in Ramanathapuram. While Pon Radhakrishnan and Raja will fight Congress, which is yet to name candidates for its nine seats in DMK alliance, Tamilisai will cross swords with DMK heavyweight Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. H Raja to contest from Sivaganga for third timeH Raja is contesting from Sivaganga for the third time. In 2014, he came third with 1.33 lakh votes, while in 1999, he came second. It will be a keenly fought battle between Tamilisai and DMK’s state women wing secretary and Rajya Sabha MP K Kanimozhi in Tuticorin. Though Tamilisai initially preferred to contest from Chennai South, which has a sizeable votebank for the party, she finally settled for Tuticorin. AIADMK was keen on retaining south Chennai for sitting MP, J Jayavardhan, son of fisheries minister D Jayakumar. Former TN BJP chief Radhakrishnan will face CPM’s P R Natarajan in Coimbatore. This is the fifth time that Radhakrishnan has been fielded in Coimbatore, a BJP stronghold. While he won two consecutive Lok Sabha elections in 1998 and 1999, he was defeated in the 2004 and 2014 polls. Nainar Nagendran has been pitted against DMK’s IUML candidate K Nawaz Kani. While the party made a quick decision on candidates for four constituencies, Ramanathapuram delayed matters considering the keen contest for the seat among some senior leaders. \nA fun filled evening for the ladies\n.description: This party hosted by a ladies' club in the city was high on entertainment. Dancing was the highlight of the do where we spotted the femme brigade dancing to latest Bollywood tracks. They also played several games.  Neha Mathur and Ruchi Jain (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L-R) Ravindra Kaur, Rashmi Pandey and Aarti Bhatnagar (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Akanksha and Anita Srivastava (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Anju Pandey and Richa Nigam (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

RML medicos assault trader, ransack stor.description: LUCKNOW: A group of MBBS students of RML Institute allegedly ransacked a general store in Gomtinagar on Monday and thrashed its owner and workers. Taking cognizance of the incident, RML director has set up a three-member committee to probe the incident and directed it to submit report within 24 hours.  The victim Ranjeet Yadav, owner of store opposite RML Institute in Vibhutikhand, later filed a complaint against unidentified students accusing them of trespassing, assault, robbery and ransacking the store following which police lodged an FIR. In his complaint, Yadav said that 10-15 MBBS students stormed into his shop at 1pm, vandalised it, assaulted him and customers and took away some articles. He said that the students asked him to down shutters in support of their strike and attacked him when he refused. Other shopkeepers rushed to his rescue and called UP100 following which force from three police stations reached the spot. SHO Vibhutikhand, Rajeev Dwivedi told TOI that police found CCTV footage and found that the dispute started when an MBBS student came to Yadav's shop to buy a deodorant. He started spraying it to check its fragrance. Yadav stopped him saying the bottle will go waste if every customer starts doing the same. The student left threatening to teach him a lesson and returned with 10-15 batchmates, vandalized the shop and thrashed staff, he added.  RML spokesperson, Dr Tribhuwan Tiwari said, "We have identified students from the footage. A committee has been formed to probe the incident and recommend action." Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Pawan Kalyan.description: GUNTUR: Stating that they will bulldoze bastions of TDP and YSR Congress, Janasena president Pawan Kalyan promised to grant Rs 5,000 pension to all farmers in the state. He said they will also grant Rs 8,000 crop incentive to farmers soon after coming into power in the next elections. Pawan further said his government would provide six to 10 LPG cylinders free-of-cost to each family every year. and also promised to fill 3 lakh vacancies in the government departments to provide jobs to youth. Addressing a meeting in Guntur on Monday, Pawan said that the future of the state did not mean the future of Lokesh and Jagan but it was the future of the people. “The space on the state’s political stage is not TDP’s and YSRC’s property as youth and women are eager to bring change through Jana Sena.” “TDP had lost moral right to rule the state as chief minister N Chandrababu Naidu had no control over his legislators who indulged in illegal activities,” Pawan said adding that he jumped into the political arena to bring in a change in the lives of commoners. “We supported TDP and BJP in the last elections with a hope to transform the state. Unfortunately, both of them have shattered our dreams,” he said. “Guntur city has been left in a lurch despite located a few kilometres away from the capital city. The entire city has been dug out in the guise of laying underground drainage scheme and left without repair. How shocking it is to see 30 people dying of diarrhoea in a city like Guntur? Is it not the failure of the state government? Opposition leader Jaganmohan Reddy is equally responsible for the tragedy as he never dared to question the government by going to the assembly,” he said. He further said they would construct apartments exclusively for Muslims in the city. He appealed to people to support his candidates Chandrasekhar (Guntur West), Zia-Ur-Rehman (East) and MP candidate Bonaboina Srinivas Yadav in the elections, Pawan said they fielded a BC candidate Srinivasa Yadav whereas TDP and YSRC both have given tickets to their own communities. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

AMMK Candidate List 2019.description: CHENNAI: AMMK deputy general secretary TTV Dhinakaran on Friday released the second and final list of candidates - 14 for the Lok Sabha polls and 9 for assembly bypoll in Tamil Nadu. The party has decided to field two of its heavyweight disqualified MLAs to contest Lok Sabha polls and to take on strong candidates from AIADMK alliance. Disqualified MLA from Andipatti and AMMK propaganda secretary, Thanga Tamilselvan, has been fielded from Theni Lok Sabha constituency, he will take on P Ravindranath Kumar, son of deputy chief minister and AIADMK coordinator O Paneerselvam. Disqualified MLA from Paapireddipatti and former minister P Palaniappan will be contesting the Lok Sabha polls from Dharmapuri constituency. He will take on PMK youth wing leader and former Union health minister Anbumani Ramadoss, who is contesting on behalf of the AIADMK-BJP-PMK alliance.| Full coverage of Lok Sabha elections in Tamil NaduBesides these two, AMMK has also selected another disqualified MLA, NG Parthibhan from Sholingar assembly segment, to contest Arakonam Lok Sabha constituency. He will take on former Unions minister of state S Jagathrakshakan of the DMK - Congress alliance on the seat. AMMK had earlier released its first list of 24 candidates for Lok Sabha and 9 candidates for assembly bypoll in the state last Sunday. Dhinakaran will release the party's manifesto for the Lok Sabha polls later during the day. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nHappiness all around at this wedding r.description: The wedding reception of Anirudh and Avni Jain was a grand affair. The ceremony had Dr Dinesh Sharma, deputy Chief Minister UP coming to bless the newlyweds. Many prominent people of the city were also present as guests including Anup Chandra Pandey, Malini Awasthi, Awanish Kumar Awasthi among others.  Dr Anup Chandra Pandey with Ashu Jain and Anita Bhatnagar Jain (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Anushree Jain and Prafful and Apoorva Jain (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Archana and Bhuvnesh Kumar with Awanish Kumar Awasthi (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Dr Rakesh Kapoor with Navneet and Vanadana Sehgal (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Eva Sharma, Malini Awasthi and Mahesh Kumar Gupta (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Pravir Kumar, Renu Prakash and OP Singh (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Suhani and Kaushal Raj Sharma and RP Singh (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Ravindra Gupta with Anil Jain & Shobha Doorwar (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Sangeeta Singh and Anil & Alka Patni (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) “Avni and I met in IIM Ahmedabad when we were doing our MBA back in 2015, we became best friends because of our mutual interest in dance. And now we are married after 3 years,” said Anirudh while Avni said she’s thankful to God that she found a loving and understanding partner in Anirudh. Sharing in the couple's happiness were their respective parents Ashu Jain-Anita Bhatnagar Jain and Anil-Alka Patni.  — Aditya Yadav Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi to begin weekly meetings.description: LUCKNOW: Moving on from the party’s worst show in Uttar Pradesh, Congress national general secretary and in charge of eastern UP Priyanka Gandhi is busy giving final shape to ‘Mission 2022’ these days. According to sources, she has been meeting a lot of people regarding the ‘mission’ these days at Rahul Gandhi’s Tughlaq Lane residence-cum-office in Delhi and will also hold weekly meetings in Uttar Pradesh. “The first few meetings will take place over the next 3-4 weeks in New Delhi. Thereafter, weekly meetings would also be organised in different parts of UP. The aim is to take stock of the party’s booth-wise presence to rebuild the organisational structure,” sources said. Priyanka had set the tone for the mission in her review of the party’s performance last week. “Jo samjhauta karna chahta hai… jiska dil is sangharsh mein nahi hai…uske liye Congress mein koi jagah nahi hai… apna man bana lijiye… party ke liye kaam karna hai toh dil se kaam karna padega,” she had said at Sonia Gandhi’s victory thanksgiving ceremony suggesting that ‘perform or perish’ was the mantra for survival in the Congress from now. Priyanka’s review was followed by an assessment by general secretary and in charge of western UP Jyotiraditya Scindia, who had indicated an impending organisational overhaul. “Priyanka’s plan is about starting from the scratch. She is collecting her own data to formulate the strategy that would begin from the booth level,” said a senior leader in the core team, adding, “Heads will also roll in the process which will weed out non-performers.” In Priyanka’s launch road show, Congress president Rahul Gandhi had said that he had brought Priyanka for ‘mission 2022’ in UP. Stating that the Congress party would form the state government in 2022, Rahul had asked Priyanka to rebuild the Congress in UP for it. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. BJP List 2019 Karnataka.description: BENGALURU: The BJP on Thursday released its first list of 21 candidates from Karnataka, but it does not include the names of sitting MP Karadi Sanganna (Koppal) or late Union minister HN Ananth Kumar’s wife Tejaswini, who is widely tipped to be the candidate from Bengaluru South. The list names the 14 other sitting MPs, including Shobha Karandlaje (Udupi-Chikkamagalur) and Suresh Angadi (Belagavi) despite stiff opposition within the party and anti-incumbency against the two. Party leaders said they are baffled by the exclusion of Tejaswini’s name and are unaware of the reasons for her candidature being withheld. “We inaugurated her personal office on Thursday and were sure of her name being announced,” one leader said. Rumours — from “technical” errors to the possibility that her name would lead to comments on “dynasty politics” — are doing the rounds. Sanganna’s candidature was withheld as the BJP is waiting for the JD(S)-Congress coalition to name its candidate. With the possibility of former chief minister Siddaramaiah contesting, the BJP will require a stronger candidate. The party also decided not to announce its candidate for Mandya, but two Congress rebels — A Manju from Hassan and Umesh Jadhav from Kalaburagi — have been given tickets. BSY has his wayThe first list confirms that the BJP central leadership continues to repose faith in state party president and Lingayat strongman BS Yeddyurappa. The list features names of his son BY Raghavendra and several confidants. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Lucknow: Drive against strays fails to p.description: LUCKNOW: Despite a high court order to make Cantonment roads free of stray cattle by June 30, the Lucknow Cantonment Board (LCB) has caught only 40% of the stray animals so far. On May 28, the high court had directed the Lucknow Municipal Corporation and Cantonment Board to remove stray cattle and garbage piles from Cantonment. On June 1, the LCB had launched a drive to catch stray animals in the civil areas, particularly Sadar and Topkhana Bazaar. But so far, only 120 stray bulls and cows out of estimated 300 have been caught. Sadar Bazaar residents say that stray cattle continue to be a menace. They cause traffic jams and pose threat to commuters and pedestrians, especially elderly and children. Stray cows can be seen in the main Sadar market in the morning. Civic authorities promises us that the menace would end whenever they launch such drives but nothing happens," said Sunil Kumar, a resident. Besides the animals also cause damage to the gardens and green areas. They also raised complaints over the issue of cattle dung on roads and outside their homes, but to no avail. Amit Mishra, CEO of Lucknow Cantonment Board, said, "We have sent 83 stray animals to Kanha Upvan while the rest will be shifted to a cow shelter in Memaura soon." UP: July 30 deadline for Aadhaar enrolme.description: LUCKNOW: The state government has given a July 30 deadline to the education department to complete the Aadhaar enrolment of over 50 lakh schoolchildren taking admissions in classes up to VIII across the state. The 12-digit unique identity number would be used to filter out fake beneficiaries of government schemes such as free of cost school uniforms, shoes, text books, midday meal and scholarships, said an official. Besides these students of 1.58 lakh government schools, Aadhaar enrolment of students of all recognised private and aided junior high schools would also be done. The director for basic education has appointed a nodal officer for completion of the work within 30 days. Secretary of Basic Shiksha Parishad Ruby Singh said, “The mass exercise will help us in removing fake beneficiaries of government schemes. The unique number will be written in the enrolment register of every child and will act as a reference number for the children during distribution of uniforms, books, shoes and meals, among others.” The instruction has been passed on to all recognized private and aided junior high schools in cities and rural areas. UP midday meal authority director Abdul Samad told TOI, “It is not that we will stop giving meals to children who do not have an Aadhaar card. But the basic education department should ensure that kids availing the schemes have the card by July-end. This will ensure transparency in the mammoth project.” The state education department has signed a memorandum of understanding with the Unique Identification Authority of India for completion of the project. Besides, an agency would be entrusted with the task of making Aadhar cards in schools under each of the 822 development blocks of the state. Around a crore students study in 1.13 lakh primary and 45,700 upper primary schools of the state. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nWhen music ruled supreme at this event.description: A private school in lucknow, celebrating 60-years of its establishemnt, organised a western classical music concert, Historic International Concert of the Indian National Youth Orchestra, conducted by Lucknow-born composer and conductor Vijay Upadhyaya.  Brigitte Oppinger-Walchshofer and Jean Claude Kugener (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Amrita Das, Jagdish Gandi and Finous (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Geeta Kingdon, Julia and Mona (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Ricky Kej, Roger and Roshan Gandhi (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) Armed with a 368-piece orchestra, with 118 musicians and 250 chorus artists from 17 foreign nations and also musicians from 11 states of India, the performance witnessed a jam-packed auditorium with people also coming in from outside of the city to listen to ‘their own Upadhyaya’. And undoubtedly the performance of the musicians left everybody in awe. Most people in the audience were seen recording the music on their mobile phones.  Vijay Upadhyaya with Dr Abhilasha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) The evening began by the lighting of the lamp by chief guest Hriday Narayan Dikshit, Speaker, Uttar Pradesh Legislative Assembly. Also present at the event was Indian Grammy award winner Ricky Kej. — Saad Abbasi In Video:When music ruled supreme at this event in Lucknow!Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Teenager tries to kill self over 'poor m.description: LUCKNOW: A 17-year-old girl tried to commit suicide on Tuesday because she did not get admission in the college of her choice after class XII. The girl jumped in front of a train in Hasanganj and was badly injured. However, a team of police took the girl to trauma centre where she was treated. In a letter, the girl, Khushi, wrote, "Due to poor grades, I did not get admission due to which I am not able to complete my studies." She also regretted that she "was a girl". If she was a boy, she wrote, she would have survived because a boy can survive even without studying. Her father Mannapal is a security guard and she has a 15-year-old brother. "I don't understand why she has taken this step. God has saved her," he said. Hasanganj SHO Dhirendra Pratap Kushwaha said the case is under government railway police. Lucknow: BJP sets eyes on Jatav, Yadav v.description: LUCKNOW: While the Samajwadi Party and BSP are still to recover from the shock of the humiliating defeat at the hands of the BJP in the recently-concluded general elections, the BJP -- in a bid to weaken the regional parties further – will begin a membership drive with main focus on Yadavs and Jatavs. In their first meeting following the parliamentary elections held on Sunday, the BJP decided to make a concerted effort to win over the traditional votebank of the two regional parties. The fresh membership drive will begin from July 6, birth anniversary of founding president of Jan Sangh -- rechristened in 1980 as BJP -- Shyama Prasad Mukherjee. Party vice-president JPS Rathore has been made in-charge of the drive that will conclude on August 10. One of the vice-presidents of the party told TOI that though BJP had won 312 Assembly seats in 2017, the 2019 Lok Sabha election saw the lead of the party coming down to 284, despite registering overall increase in vote share in 385 Assembly seats. The BJP leadership, while deliberating at length on the success of the party in the Lok Sabha elections, emphasised that the membership drive should have focus on members of Jatav and Yadav communities who voted in less number for the BJP as compared to other social sections. \nSpreading cheers among cops\u2019 kids.description: A cultural event Children Summer Carnival was held recently at the Reserve Police Line, Mahanagar. The event was organised by the UP Police Family Welfare Association for the wives of the Uttar Pradesh policemen. The guest of honour at the event was Neelam Singh, a lawyer and the wife of the Director General Police UP. The event exhibited paintings and drawings by children which sought much attention. The event also spread awareness regarding voting among those present.  The highlight of the event was the dance competition where children participated in good numbers. A classical dance reciatl by Unnati Giri won many hearts and a Bhangra dance performance on Punjabi songs was loved by most.  (L-R) Kalanidhi Naithani, Sarvesh Kumar Mishra and Vijay Shankar Agnihotri (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Vikrant Vir (L) and Abhishek Verma and Manju Srivastava (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Dr Anshita Verma (L) & Kalyani Verma and Dr Pravin Ajaz (L) and Anshu (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Deepti (L) and Saeeda Saira (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Present at the event was Minakshi Krishna Sima Modi, Dr Pravin Ajaz, Niharika Singh and Shephali Bhagat among others. — Vishnu Jaiswal In Video:Spreading cheers among cops’ kids in LucknowDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Residency to relive 1857 revolt in Big B.description: LUCKNOW: Whizzing bullets. Thundering cannons. And, an unforgettable uprising that laid the foundation of India’s freedom from colonial rule. The Revolt of 1857 will come alive at the Residency this Independence Day, courtesy a sound and light show that might boast a voice over by Amitabh Bachchan. The state tourism department has sanctioned a budget of Rs 5 crore for the son et lumière that is being revived after almost a decade. Funds have already been sent to Uttar Pradesh Rajkiya Nagar Nigam for the production and permission has been sought from the Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to host the show like it is done at Mysore Palace (Karnataka) and Victoria Memorial (Kolkata). The 16-page script — beginning from the time when Lucknow was called Lakshmanpuri — to the gallantry of heroes led by Begum Hazrat Mahal against the colonial might — has been revised and approved by former ASI superintendent AR Siddiqui. Complete with 4D effects, the 30-minute show will play on loop for four hours every evening in front of the memorial museum. “The sound and light show will take people back in time when the siege happened inside the Residency premises. The show had been withdrawn after 2010 because we had not been able to get mandatory approval from the ASI headquarters in Delhi. This year, all formalities have been completed. On August 15 and thereafter, Lucknow will witness history and the role of Awadh in it,” said PK Singh, joint director of UP tourism. “The need to revive the sound and light show was felt because it helps today’s generation understand the significance of historical monuments,” Singh added. While a Mumbai-based digital company has been roped in for the production, a proposal has been sent to Big B to lend his baritone voice to the show. An official confirmation from the actor is awaited, but sources have said he is unlikely to turn down the offer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Arvind Kejriwal.description: VISAKHAPATNAM: Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that Congress President Rahul Gandhi has refused to forge an alliance with the AAP for the Lok Sabha polls in the national capital. Full coverage: Lok Sabha electionsTalking to reporters at the airport here, the AAP leader said he had met Gandhi recently and the Congress leader had refused to “join hands with the AAP”. Asked about Congress' Delhi unit president Sheila Dikshit's remarks that Kejriwal never approached her for an alliance, the chief minister said, “We have met Rahul Gandhi. Dikshit is not that important leader.” Kejriwal has been urging the Congress to stitch an alliance in Delhi for the Lok Sabha polls to keep the BJP away from power. Leaders in the Delhi unit of the Congress were divided over the issue of alliance with Dikshit and her three working presidents opposing it, party sources had said. A top source in the party had recently said that chances of alliance were "slim" considering its long term repercussions in Delhi. "The biggest question is how will Congress face the AAP in Assembly elections due in 2020 after the tie up. Also, the party does not gain much politically as it is being offered only 2-3 seats by Kejriwal," the source had said. Congress had drawn a blank in the 2014 parliamentary elections in Delhi. The talk of alliance was fuelled by the fact that the Congress and AAP had jointly polled more votes than the BJP that had walked away with all the seven seats in the national capital. Delhi has 7 Lok Sabha seats and it will go to polls on May 12. In Video:Congress refused to forge alliance with AAP for LS polls: KejriwalDownload The Times of India News App for Latest Elections News.

Lucknow beams with happiness on Happy St.description: Just like the streets of Chatori Gali have become synonymous with Happy Streets, so are its fans who have been a part and parcel of the event since its inception in Lucknow. While the family of Happy Streets is growing every passing year, the excitement among the revellers who have been constant with the event from Season 1 to Season 4, remains the same. Zoha Azeem and her family have been attending Happy Streets since it became a part of the City of Nawabs. "When I first attended the event, I came along with my family and a bunch of school friends. This year, when we saw the Happy Streets ad on TOI's Facebook page, I told my parents not to schedule anything for Sunday. Though we stay in Indiranagar, we make it a point to learn activities here and make new friends," said Zoha. Another loyal visitor, Harish Choudhary said it is his love of roller-skating that brings him to the event every season. "Roller skating is the most sought after activity for youths and adults alike, while Zumba is the one which majorly attracts youngsters here. It was here that I first learned a few techniques from the fellow skaters. It has been giving a platform to children like us to showcase our talent and take it forward in the future," he said. "We have been attending Happy Streets often as the children get to run around the vehicle free streets. They can jump, laugh and play with other children in the area," said Mona Roy, a resident of Gomtinagar. The Happy Street craze is not only visible among the residents, but also the trainers at the event. " We never miss an opportunity to walk along the Happy Street. We feel proud that we get a chance to perform and show our skills in a traffic less space," said Arti Jaiswal, a martial arts trainer. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Five persons including three toddlers di.description: LUCKNOW: Five persons including three toddlers died while 19 persons were injured when a tractor-trolley overturned in Maharajganj police station area in Balrampur district on early Monday. Police said that three persons-Bharat (25), his wife Resham (23) and his son Nanhu (03) died on the spot, while two others-Satish (03) and Nandini (01) of another family were declared brought dead at the government district hospital. Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath has expressed condolence on the incident and also instructed authorities to provide all possible medical aid to the injured. According to the police, around 3 am on Monday, 15 labourers working at a brick kiln with their families were on their way to Lohepaniya village when their vehicle reached Kovapur railway crossing the driver lost control on the wheels and the tractor overturned in a ditch. Hearing a loud thud, villagers woke up and informed the police. ASP (Balrampur) Arvind Mishra told TOI that eight persons have been discharged while 11 are still recuperating at the hospital. 5 killed in UP's Balrampur as tractor tr.description: BALRAMPUR: Five persons, including three belonging to a family, were killed when the tractor trolley in which they were travelling overturned into a roadside ditch on Monday in Uttar Pradesh's Balrampur district, police said. Seventeen persons were also injured in the incident and have been admitted to the district hospital. Conditions of five of those injured were stated to be critical. Police said labourers working at a brick kiln were on their way to Lohepaniya village when the vehicle lost its balance and overturned near Kovapur. Those killed were identified as Bharat (25), his wife Resham (23), their son Nanhu (2), Satish (3) and Nandini (1). Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Amitabh Bachchan begins shooting for Gul.description: Amitabh Bachchan reached Lucknow on Tuesday afternoon to begin shooting for Shoojit Sircar's 'Gulabo Sitabo'. With an extensive schedule planned in the city till the end of July, the film is written by Lucknowite and National Award winner Juhi Chaturvedi. Giving Bachchan company on screen is Ayushmann Khurrana, who has always called himself a huge fan of the senior actor. Bachchan Senior reached Lucknow on a chartered plane and also wrote about beginning the film shoot in Lucknow on Twitter.  In an interview with Mumbai Mirror, while talking about the film, Shoojit Sircar said, "Gulabo Sitabo are popular glove puppet characters in Uttar Pradesh. In the story Sitabo is the worn-out, overworked wife of a man, while Gulabo is his enticing mistress. It is peppered with local humour and songs that depict the nuances of daily life." The shoot begins in Qaiserbagh from today in a private house and will also be conducted at a few locations in the city including the City Station and Aminabad. Scored 5 out of 300 in Lucknow Universit.description: LUCKNOW: Seeking admission to MBA in LU? Even if you have scored as low as five marks in the Lucknow University management entrance test, you stand a chance of getting admission to the course. LU has invited all candidates who have appeared for the entrance test for admission to its management courses for counselling on Tuesday. A candidate scoring marks even in single digit in the entrance test is likely to get admission. This is because for admission to 600 MBA seats, only 742 candidates had appeared for the entrance test. Besides, a number of candidates did not turn up for counselling. As a result, low scorers are likely to get an opportunity for admission as the difference between the total number of seats and the number of candidates is very low. LU offers six management courses. While there is maximum rush for regular MBA, seats in other courses—MBA (finance & control), MBA (human resources & industrial relations), MBA (marketing), MBA (international business) and master’s in tourism and total management, often remain vacant. In the overall merit list for the six courses, all candidates from rank 1 till rank 742 have been called. The candidate with the last rank has scored 5 marks in the entrance test out of 300. “A number of candidates don’t take admission if they don’t get admission in the most sought after MBA courses offered due to lack of career prospects. As a result, in the remaining management courses, admission is a cake walk,” said an LU official. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Satta Market.description: BHOPAL: This assembly  is turning out to be a nail-biter. The Bhopal satta bazaar that gave BJP a good chance three weeks ago is suddenly abuzz about Congress’ prospects. As per the bookies, till about a month ago, if a person placed a bet of Rs 10,000 on BJP, he would get Rs 11,000 if the party returned to power. And anyone who bet Rs 4,400 on Congress would get Rs 10,000 if the opposition wins. This week, bookies say, they are taking bets on number of seats and not on who would form the government. “In case no party gets absolute majority, or if the scoreline is too close,” explained a bookie. “We do not want to say which party will form the government. The bets are open. The satta market is running good this poll season, as it is a thrilling contest,” he added. Bookies told TOI that satta trends may not reflect the actual situation on the ground, but the market is accepting bets on 116-plus seats for Congress and 102 or more for ruling BJP. “Anyone who bets successfully on BJP or Congress will double his money,” a bookie said, adding that this trend may change just as suddenly in the next few days as campaigning gets more intense. The same bookie had told TOI around a month ago that rates may vary once candidates are finalised by the parties, “but we expect the trend to remain the same”. The satta market runs into crores in every election. Bets are placed not just over phone, but also on websites and apps, leaving almost no room for police to track down bookies and those placing bets. Probably, this is why no gang has been busted in the state so far for running an election betting racket. At least two cases of betting are registered daily in Bhopal, but the people pulling the strings of the racket in poll season are yet to be caught. Police officers say it is getting increasingly difficult to nab such gangs because they are constantly on the move. “Online betting can be operated even from a moving car, a café or any public place anywhere in the country. Those running the betting in Bhopal may be sitting anywhere on the globe,” said an officer. SP-south Rahul Kumar Lodha said a special campaign is being run against criminals involved in gambling and betting ahead of elections. “These criminals are made to sign bonds to prevent them from committing such crimes in the future. Raids are being conducted on specific tips. A list of habitual offenders is being prepared by police stations to curb such illegal activities,” he said. ASP-crime Rashmi Mishra said the crime branch has activated its network of informers prior to elections to keep an eye on betting. “It is difficult to crack online betting and gambling rackets, but police take action against criminals on specific inputs. For instance, we were tipped off on Monday night about a betting den in Kolar. It was raided but no such activity was found,” Mishra said, adding that the cyber cell is constantly on the lookout for websites and mobile apps used by betting rackets. Stress on anti-romeo squads, encourage w.description: LUCKNOW: The country’s largest police force got a new additional director general of police (law and order) on Monday. PV Ramasastry, an Indian Police Service (IPS) of 1989-batch has replaced Anand Kumar who was promoted to the rank of DG and has now been posted in the same capacity in the Prisons department. Ramasastry, in his first interaction with the newsmen in the capital, laid stress on the working of anti-romeo sqauds and also asked women to report about crime against them. Talking about the recent rapes in the state, the officer said "after a spate of such incidents there is usually a lull. This has happened time and again, but we will strive not to get such instances repeated,” added Ramasastry. The instructions down the line are very clear, that is only to work. "If any complaint comes in this department then action against the errant official is also taken very swiftly,” said Ramasastry, answering a question on corruption in the police department. Lucknow civic body fires, hires & fires.description: LUCKNOW: The Lucknow Municipal Corporation (LMC) has terminated the contracts of three private agencies that were hired despite being blacklisted for shoddy performance in the past, but it is yet to initiate action against its own officials who engaged them a second time. According to LMC records, the original contracts of these agencies were revoked and they were blacklisted in December 2018 for slacking off on garbage collection, cleaning drains and sweeping roads. However, they were hired once more in March this year by the corporation’s zonal officials. The anomalies came to light recently when municipal commissioner Indramani Tripathi was reviewing complaint registers. Residents of Raqabganj and Aashiana had voiced maximum grievances. On enquiry, Tripathi found that the three agencies at fault had earlier held contracts of Campbell Road, Yahiyaganj and Jankipuram extension. They were hired again by LMC zonal offices for Raqabganj, Aashiana and Alambagh. Tripathi said he had cancelled the contracts once more and ordered a probe into the role of zonal officials in hiring blacklisted agencies. New agencies have now been entrusted with cleanliness work in the affected areas, he added. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

UP government to now issue press release.description: LUCKNOW: In a bid to promote Sanskrit, the Uttar Pradesh government will now issue press releases in Sanskrit along with Hindi, English and Urdu, an official said Tuesday. The first press note in Sanskrit was issued by the state government's Information Department on Monday. Senior officials of the Information Department said the important speeches of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath and government information will be released also in Sanskrit, along with Hindi, English and Urdu. The department has decided to take help of Lucknow-based Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan for translating chief minister's speeches for public release. "This is the first time that such a step is being taken. The speech of chief minister (Yogi Adityanath) delivered at a recent NITI Aayog meeting in New Delhi was released in Sanskrit and was well received. Now we plan to expand it further," the official said. During a function on Monday, Adityanath had said that Sanskrit was in the DNA of the country. "Sanskrit is in the DNA of India, it is now limited to the work of priests," he had said. Now, UP press releases will be in Sanskr.description: LUCKNOW: In a bid to promote Sanskrit, the Uttar Pradesh government will now issue press releases in Sanskrit along with Hindi, English and Urdu, an official said on Tuesday. The first press note in Sanskrit was issued by the state government’s information department on Monday. Information department officials said the important speeches of CM Yogi Adityanath and government information will be released also in Sanskrit, along with Hindi, English and Urdu. “This is the first time that such a step is being taken. The speech of CM delivered at a recent Niti Aayog meeting was released in Sanskrit and was well received. Now we plan to expand it further”.
